title: a CMake error while installing onnx master using "pip install ./onnx"
body_html:
hi I tried pip install ./onnx in the downloaded onnx-master directory, but got a cMake error:

**CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:11 (PROJECT): Generator

NMake Makefiles

does not support platform specification, but platform

x64

was specified.

CMake Error: CMAKE_C_COMPILER not set, after EnableLanguage
CMake Error: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER not set, after EnableLanguage
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!**

Seems to be a cMake error. But I am not familiar with cMake. Can anyone please advise? Do I need to install the Visio Stidio to get the compiler?

CONTEXT:
windos 7 64bit, AnoConda3 64bit, python 3.6,

Originally posted by @hanzhaogang in #6300 (comment)

body:
hi I tried pip install ./onnx in the downloaded onnx-master directory, but got a cMake error:

**CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:11 (PROJECT): Generator

    NMake Makefiles

  does not support platform specification, but platform

    x64

  was specified.


CMake Error: CMAKE_C_COMPILER not set, after EnableLanguage
CMake Error: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER not set, after EnableLanguage
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!**


Seems to be a cMake error. But I am not familiar with cMake. Can anyone please advise? Do I need to install the Visio Stidio to get the compiler?

CONTEXT:
windos 7 64bit, AnoConda3 64bit, python 3.6,
